channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Stretch of several street lights, 31st October
item.description:
A stretch of several street lights are out from Fairmont street to the A435 roundabout. Also a couple out on stoke road. It’s pitch black and very unsafe for pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path ABA6 deliberately blocked by fence and large bushes, 31st October
item.description:
The public right of way ABA6 between Elem Garden Drive and Bamfurlong Drive has been deliberately blocked by fence and large bushes for some years now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elm Garden Drive, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction caused by tree problem, 31st October
item.description:
Fallen tree blocking pathway and broken fence panels

item.title: TMC - Defects - Signs & Street Furniture problem, 31st October
item.description:
Corroded Directional Sign CW ENWD 2 way traffic lights TM W3W Location ultra.investors.testing MAKE SAFE ONLY,ENQUIRY RAISED FOR AHR TO ARRANGE REINSTATEMENT Stats required (Damaged Traffic Sign)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 31st October
item.description:
Heavily Corroded directional sign CW. Posts corroded midway, can you please pass on to the relevant AHR to arrange reinstatement. Make safe ticket will be raised.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: Blocked gully, 31st October
item.description:

item.title: Flooding on roundabout between Sandy Lane and Greenhills Rd and in adjacent north end of Sandy Lane due to multiple blocked drains on Sandy Lane and on the roundabout (sounds like blocked drains reported already but now there is flooding of the roads), 31st October
item.description:
Roundabout between Greenhills Rd and Sandy Lane and adjacent north end of Sandy Lane

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Sandy Lane, Cheltenham

item.title: White Lines need repainting, 31st October
item.description:
White lines need repainting on Roundabout. When heading Eastbound along A40 (from Twigworth) to Golden Valley, please can a sign be erected indicating the four filter lane directions. On many occasions, vehicles use lane 2 to use the 3rd exit, cutting up vehicles and causing near misses.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmbridge Court Roundabout, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, New Street, St Paul’s, Cheltenham

item.title: Nitrous oxide canister in grass, 31st October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 31st October
item.description:
Customer states that the drain is blocked and does not appear to be taking in water. Is concerned that this is leading to damp in the cellar of property.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A new bollard is needed here to prevent people driving on the pavement, 31st October
item.description:
On the corner between number 4 and the Old Dairy (number 2). There is a bollard between number 4 and number 8, but people are regularly driving on the pavement outside number 4. This is dangerous for pedestrians and cars/lorries are coming very close to the houses. A new bollard would solve this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven cracked pavement, 31st October
item.description:
Along the red brick wall between 27 Queens Rd and Christchurch Rd junction. This is the main thoroughfare from the station into town. It is a disgrace. It is dark and full of uneven pavement. I last fell 5 years ago and have heard of countless other examples. Nothing has been done in the 10 years that I have lived on the road. Highly dangerous for old people and I have sustained knee injury and grazed elbow and damaged clothes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Queen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: A resident reported a broken glass pane., 31st October

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
